======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1857672834.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz -int 187465780 187465780 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 699 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 2 individuals
 --read 952 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 134 individuals
 --read 2148 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1256 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 952 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 892 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 953 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 891 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 134 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 2 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [187465780,187465780]
                      buffer: 250 kb

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 2095652837.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz -int 5030822 5030822 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/output_warnings

You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 228725700.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz -int 59257464 59257464 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/output_warnings

-----------------

 --read 811 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --read 1018 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --detected 31 individuals
 --read 2051 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --no SNPs removed

 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1018 SNPs in Panel 2

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 976 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 2022467228.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz -int 85189259 85189259 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 764 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 2 individuals
 --read 1362 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 133 individuals
 --read 3179 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1889 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1362 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1290 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 2015357906.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/input.gen.gz -int 28021157 28021157 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/output_warnings

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1523210097.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/input.gen.gz -int 162546619 162546619 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 726 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 2 individuals
 --read 1622 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 25 individuals
 --read 2200 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 853 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1622 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1347 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1135451423.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/input.gen.gz -int 63769835 63769835 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 422 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 2 individuals
 --read 682 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 133 individuals
 --read 1570 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 905 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 682 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 665 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --325 type 2 SNPs
 --12 type 3 SNPs
 --337 total SNPs

-Downstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --339 type 2 SNPs
 --6 type 3 SNPs
 --345 total SNPs

-Analysis region (as defined by -int argument)
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 683 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 664 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 133 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 2 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [63769835,63769835]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 80 [Panel 1]; 80 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 266 [Panel 1->2]

---------
 Run log 
---------

MCMC iteration [1/30]

MCMC iteration [2/30]

MCMC iteration [3/30]

RESETTING PARAMETERS FOR "SURROGATE FAMILY" MODELING
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

MCMC iteration [4/30]

MCMC iteration [5/30]

MCMC iteration [6/30]

MCMC iteration [7/30]

MCMC iteration [8/30]

MCMC iteration [9/30]

MCMC iteration [10/30]

MCMC iteration [11/30]

MCMC iteration [12/30]

MCMC iteration [13/30]

MCMC iteration [14/30]

MCMC iteration [15/30]

MCMC iteration [16/30]

MCMC iteration [17/30]

MCMC iteration [18/30]

MCMC iteration [19/30]

MCMC iteration [20/30]

MCMC iteration [21/30]

MCMC iteration [22/30]

MCMC iteration [23/30]

MCMC iteration [24/30]

MCMC iteration [25/30]

MCMC iteration [26/30]

MCMC iteration [27/30]

MCMC iteration [28/30]

MCMC iteration [29/30]

MCMC iteration [30/30]


diploid sampling success rate: 0.995

haploid sampling success rate: (no haploid sampling performed)


--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 961937306.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0058/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0058/input.gen.gz -int 31009658 31009658 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0058/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0058/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0058/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

--------------

             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0058/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0058/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0058/output_warnings

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file

 --detected 2 individuals

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

 --removed 7342 SNPs

 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2 SNPs in Panel 2

 --removed 0 out of 3 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1075410453.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/input.gen.gz -int 94741246 94741246 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/output_warnings

You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1348415868.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/input.gen.gz -int 70429927 70429927 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 605 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 2 individuals
 --read 1273 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 134 individuals
 --read 2438 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1378 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1273 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1060 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --550 type 2 SNPs
 --100 type 3 SNPs
 --650 total SNPs

-Downstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --509 type 2 SNPs
 --114 type 3 SNPs
 --623 total SNPs

-Analysis region (as defined by -int argument)
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1274 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1059 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 134 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 2 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [70429927,70429927]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 80 [Panel 1]; 80 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 268 [Panel 1->2]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/output_warnings

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 840431951.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/input.gen.gz -int 107730976 107730976 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 740 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 2 individuals
 --read 689 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 134 individuals
 --read 1832 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1216 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 689 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 616 SNPs with data in multiple panels

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 841371275.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/input.gen.gz -int 40236043 40236043 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 500 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --read 912 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 134 individuals
 --read 2363 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1476 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 912 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 887 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1886997752.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0114/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0114/input.gen.gz -int 126747351 126747351 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0114/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0114/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0114/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0114/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0114/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0114/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0114/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0114/output_warnings

diploid sampling success rate: 0.983

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 356259046.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/input.gen.gz -int 180412336 180412336 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/output_warnings

-----------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:
