======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 340798201.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/input.gen.gz -int 123479639 123479639 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 757 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 2 individuals
 --read 899 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 32 individuals
 --read 1646 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 868 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 899 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 778 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 121189096.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0181/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0181/input.gen.gz -int 103435530 103435530 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0181/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr8_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0181/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0181/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr8_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0181/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0181/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0181/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0181/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0181/output_warnings

You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1672901362.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0193/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0193/input.gen.gz -int 10788776 10788776 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0193/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr20_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0193/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0193/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr20_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0193/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0193/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0193/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0193/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0193/output_warnings

 --read 1372 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 648610102.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0209/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0209/input.gen.gz -int 71285317 71285317 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0209/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr11_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0209/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0209/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr11_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0209/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0209/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0209/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0209/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0209/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr11_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 535 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0209/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 2 individuals
 --read 1035 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0209/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 133 individuals
 --read 3048 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2058 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1035 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 990 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs

 --579 total SNPs

 --0 type 0 SNPs

 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1036 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 989 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 133 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 2 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [71285317,71285317]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 80 [Panel 1]; 80 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 266 [Panel 1->2]

diploid sampling success rate: 0.994

haploid sampling success rate: (no haploid sampling performed)


--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1720887351.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0239/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0239/input.gen.gz -int 147764248 147764248 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0239/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0239/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0239/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0239/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0239/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0239/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0239/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0239/output_warnings

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1385284269.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0260/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0260/input.gen.gz -int 184570593 184570593 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0260/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0260/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0260/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0260/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0260/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0260/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0260/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0260/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 556 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0260/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 2 individuals
 --read 799 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0260/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 134 individuals
 --read 2149 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1381 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 799 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 768 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 800 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 767 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 134 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 2 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [184570593,184570593]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 80 [Panel 1]; 80 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 268 [Panel 1->2]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/input.gen.gz -int 180526696 180526696 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/output_warnings

 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 826 SNPs in Panel 2

 --removed 0 out of 817 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 198190163.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0290/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0290/input.gen.gz -int 6402893 6402893 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0290/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0290/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0290/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0290/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0290/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0290/output_info_by_sample

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1613153390.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0340/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0340/input.gen.gz -int 64317287 64317287 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0340/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr13_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0340/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0340/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr13_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0340/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0340/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0340/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0340/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0340/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr13_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 754 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0340/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 2 individuals
 --read 484 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0340/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 133 individuals
 --read 2209 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1765 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 484 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 444 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --377 type 2 SNPs
 --39 type 3 SNPs
 --416 total SNPs

-Downstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --66 type 2 SNPs
 --2 type 3 SNPs
 --68 total SNPs

-Analysis region (as defined by -int argument)
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 485 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 443 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 133 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 2 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [64317287,64317287]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 80 [Panel 1]; 80 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 266 [Panel 1->2]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr14_combined_b37.txt

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/output_warnings

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

ERROR: There are no type 2 SNPs after applying the command-line settings for this run, which makes it impossible to perform imputation. One possible reason is that you have specified an analysis interval (-int) that contains reference panel SNPs but not inference panel SNPs -- e.g., this can happen at the ends of chromosomes. Another possibility is that your genotypes and the reference panel are mapped to different genome builds, which can lead the same SNPs to be assigned different positions in different panels. If you need help fixing this error, please contact the authors.

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 2041030219.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370sd/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370sd/input.gen.gz -int 20523200 20523200 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370sd/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370sd/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370sd/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370sd/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370sd/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370sd/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370sd/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370sd/output_warnings

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file

 --read 503 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --detected 27 individuals
 --read 1307 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 633 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1469819186.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/input.gen.gz -int 28950753 28950753 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr17_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr17_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/output_warnings

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 723888071.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/input.gen.gz -int 25909500 25909500 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr20_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr20_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr20_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 195 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 2 individuals
 --read 4 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 30 individuals
 --read 968 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 963 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 4 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 5 SNPs with data in multiple panels

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 39392855.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/input.gen.gz -int 48921073 48921073 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 564 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 2 individuals
 --read 1005 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 129 individuals
 --read 2437 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1477 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1005 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 960 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --319 type 2 SNPs
 --14 type 3 SNPs
 --333 total SNPs

-Downstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --640 type 2 SNPs
 --32 type 3 SNPs
 --672 total SNPs

-Analysis region (as defined by -int argument)
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1006 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 959 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 129 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 2 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [48921073,48921073]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 80 [Panel 1]; 80 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 258 [Panel 1->2]

diploid sampling success rate: 0.996

haploid sampling success rate: (no haploid sampling performed)


--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1994941784.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0786/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0786/input.gen.gz -int 28568862 28568862 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0786/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0786/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0786/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0786/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0786/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0786/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0786/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0786/output_warnings

-----------------

 Imputation accuracy assessment
